content: acorn lantern these adorable acorn lanterns are knit entirely in the round from the bottom up on dpns the candle is embroidered on using a chain stitch on the front side the candle is lit on the back side the candle is out the bottom has been left open so that they can stand independently and so the embroidery is easier to do a handle has been added for those who want to hang them i think they would make a fun prop for your dolls or gnomes or a wonderful addition to a seasonal display i hope they bring you joy copyright 2023 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 acorn lantern instructions using your base color cast on 14 sts divide the stitches over 3 dpns and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 purl round 3 knit cut yarn change to nut/lantern color round 4-11 knit cut yarn change to cap color remove a needle redistribute the stitches so that needle 1 & 2 now have 7 sts each finished measurements round 12 knit height without handle 2 5 / 6cm or desired size round 13 p1 k1 repeat till end of round height with handles 4 /10 cm or desired size round 14 k1 p1 repeat till end of round round 15-16 repeat round 13 & 14 approximate yardage round 17 ssk p1 k1 p1 k2tog repeat 10 sts 3 yards total this is a great scrappy project round 18 ssk p1 k2tog repeat 6 sts round 19 k2tog k1 repeat 4 sts yarn round 20-21 knit i used patons classic worsted because i like a nice firm break yarn leaving an 8 /20cm end for the handle fabric but you can use any size yarn you wish draw end through the remaining 4 stitches pull tight color suggestions and secure with a knot base green pine using your end make a loop for the handle and knot to nut/lantern light brown honey the opposite side my handles are about 1 5 /4cm cap dark brown heath heather high hide end inside of stem needles finishing one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 step 1 hide any remaining ends by pushing them up 2 75mm or desired size into your lantern i like to push them up into the cap so they are out of my way for my embroidery gauge optional step 2 embroider on your candle using a chain stitch 6 stitches and 6 row = 1 /2 5cm over stockinette cut a 10 /25cm piece of candle colored yarn thread it notions onto a tapestry needle and insert it into the center stitch just above your green purl-bump round don t small amount of stuffing & tapestry needle forget to leave space for a flame at the top when video links done knot the two ends together and hide inside how to do a chain stitch step 3 if desired repeat step 2 on the back
